comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: Typo in your title, they are Princes, NOT Princess.

comment.author: 89688718@N00
comment._content: Echo the comment above. I had to look up the plural form of "prince" to make sure.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: I think this photo was taken at th esame time as en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Maximilian_II_of_Bavaria_with_... en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_II_of_Bavaria dates that as from 1860. Ludwig died in 1886 under mysterious circumstances. Otto [ en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otto_of_Bavaria ] succeeded him but was incapacitated by "severe mental illness" and a regent ruled in his stead. He died in November 1913.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.neuschwanstein-tour-guide.com/king_ludwig.htm includes another picture of the two in the same location (and probably on the same occasion).

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Retired at last:  Thanks for catching the typo in the title. We will correct it. 
swanq: Thanks for providing information about these young Princes of Bavaria, and clarifying the date of the original image (ca. 1860). The Bain Service's tendency to use older images to illustrate current affairs poses a challenge sometimes! We will update the record to reflect some of this information.
